bot_dialog: Isn't it fun to go on a treasure hunt to explore new places? Where would you like to go for exploration if you had a magic map?
suggested_activities: Watch a fun video about kids exploring a new place and listen carefully to how they say 'exploration'.
Use an online tool with buttons—each one says a different phoneme for 'exploration': ɪ - k - s - p - l - ɔː - ˈr - eɪ - ʃ - ən. Try clicking them!
Let's draw a map of an imaginary island. Every time we draw something new that we could explore, say 'exploration'.
Record yourself using a simple device saying the word 'exploration' slowly; listen to hear if it sounds like the video!
Let’s play a word-building game on a tablet, using drag and drop to create 'exploration'. It’ll help you connect each sound.
native_sentence: Le mot en français pour 'exploration' est 'exploration'.
follow_ups: What was the place the kids explored in the video? Try saying 'exploration' after watching.
Can you press each phoneme button two times and say them out loud?
What new thing would you like to draw next? Remember to say 'exploration' after each item.
Did listening to yourself saying 'exploration' help you hear the parts correctly?
Which sounds stood out when you played the word-building game?
